description: The camera defines the position, tilt, and heading of the point from which the SceneView's visible extent is observed.
title: Camera

___tilt.description: The tilt of the camera in degrees with respect to the surface as projected down from the camera position. Tilt is zero when looking straight down at the surface and 90 degrees when the camera is looking parallel to the surface.

___heading.description: The heading of the camera in degrees. Heading is zero when north is the top of the screen. It increases as the view rotates clockwise.

$eref.description: Defines the JSON formats of the point and spatial reference objects.
$eref.title: pointGeometry

___m.description: M coordinate which contains measures used for linear referencing.

___x.description: X coordinate which is measured along the east/west axis.

___y.description: Y coordinate which is measured along the north/south axis.

___spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

___z.description: Z coordinate which measures height or elevation.

___position.description: The position of the camera defined by a map point.
